perturbation.original_text: (a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the      Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]      US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th      day of each month;
perturbation.changed_text: (a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the      Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]      US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 60th day of each month;
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates that monthly payments are due by the 10th of each month. Changing this to the 60th of each month creates a contradiction, as months do not have 60 days. This creates an ambiguous and potentially unenforceable payment term, violating standard contract law principles regarding clarity and definiteness in payment schedules.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Requirement for Definite and Certain Terms

perturbation.original_text: (c)  Both Parties shall keep true and accurate books and records of all revenue      generated as a result of the Co-Branded Site. Either Party shall have the      right from time to time to audit and make extracts of the books and records      of the other, insofar as said books or records pertain to the terms of this      Agreement. Any such audit shall take place upon not less than seven (7)      days advance written notice, during normal business hours of normal      business days and at reasonable intervals. Any such audit shall be at the
perturbation.changed_text: (c)  Both Parties shall keep true and accurate books and records of all revenue      generated as a result of the Co-Branded Site. Either Party shall have the      right from time to time to audit and make extracts of the books and records      of the other, insofar as said books or records pertain to the terms of this      Agreement. Any such audit shall take place upon not less than one (1) day advance written notice, during normal business hours of normal      business days and at unreasonable intervals. Any such audit shall be at the
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the audit notice period from seven (7) days to one (1) day is unreasonable and potentially violates the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, which is part of contract law in California, where HCI is located. Additionally, changing from 'reasonable intervals' to 'unreasonable intervals' introduces uncertainty and contradicts the principle of fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing, Contract Law - Reasonable Notice Requirements

perturbation.original_text: During the Term of this Agreement and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) month thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the restriction period on using user data from six months to one month is a legal contradiction because it unreasonably shortens the time frame for protecting user privacy. This action is problematic because, under Canadian and US laws (where the entities operate), data use is regulated, and one month may be deemed insufficient to protect users from targeted advertising or competitive practices based on their data, conflicting with consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws, Privacy Laws (e.g., PIPEDA in Canada, state privacy laws in the US)
